timeline.bodyText: The PR description says that tests are not needed. We can extract this part and put it under test.
timeline.author: ezaquarii

replies.bodyText:
hm, I'm not completely convinced, that we can extract it because without pattern1 I think the account wouldn't be found if someone wants to open a link containing index.php and we just had pattern2 or are you completely sure about that?
I will test out if it works without pattern1
And actually I have no clue about how to add tests, so I would need your help in that case
I am fairly new to Java programming and this is my first Android PR ever...
replies.author: szaimen

replies.bodyText:
I've tested removing pattern1 and matcher1 and the opening of internal links that contain index.php doesn't work if we do that, it just says that no account was found but there is definitely one.
You can test it yourself by installing #6120 (comment)
and trying to open an internal link from your testdomain that contains index.php.
replies.author: szaimen

replies.bodyText:
@szaimen Enire link maching functionality should be extracted into a function/class and tested for all desired inputs. This links matching code is simple, but it feels like having very complex business rules.
Since this module has complex behaviour, BDD style test seems to be suitable for this case.

And actually I have no clue about how to add tests, so I would need your help in that case

There are plenty of examples in our code base. You just create a class with a method annotated with @Test and the test runner runs it. It's as trivial as creating a "Hello world". You'll find examples in test and androidTest directories.
Try it out and I'll help you if you get stuck.
